page.title: 20Biography - The Brudenells
page.content: The Brudenells have lived in Northants since the 13th century, and have been at Deene Hall since 1514. Sir Thomas Brudenell was created Earl of Cardigan in 1661, and the title remained in the family at Deene until the death of the 7th Earl in 1868.(The Earl being remembered as the arrogant and controversial hero of Balaclava.) Then, on the death of Lady Cardigan in 1915 Deene passed to the 3rd Earl's grandsons...Ernest,died 1917, and George,father of the present owner. Since 1962 the occupants of Deene Hall have been Edmund Brudenell and his wife the Hon. Marian Manningham-Buller.... who have three children - Robert, Thomas and Anna Maria.
